summary: "Bonanza" is an American Western TV show that aired on NBC from 1959 to 1973. It's about the Cartwright family, who live near Virginia City, Nevada, in the 1860s. The series stars Lorne Greene, Pernell Roberts, Dan Blocker, and Michael Landon. "Bonanza" is one of the longest-running live-action American series, known for its moral dilemmas. The title refers to a big silver ore deposit, linked to the Comstock Lode discovery in 1859. The show's theme song became popular. "Bonanza" has been recognized as one of TV Guide's greatest shows.
title: Bonanza
